website_summaries.verdict: An affordable variety pack of high-quality training dummies.
pros: 6-pack comes with a combination of white, black, and orange dummies
Firm, durable materials help discourage chewing, making the dummies last longer
10-inch-long rope and weighted design, makes it easy to throw long-distance
cons: Rope does come untied on occasion, try using a double knot

customer_reviews.title: A great lab training tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have a six month old lab, and these are his favorite thing. They appear to be indestructible, are easy to grasp in his jaws for land and water retreival. The material is firm but not too hard, so we have seen no damage to the mouth for repeated retrieval. This set comes with plenty (three white, two orange, and one black and white). I would note that the black and white one is called a "flasher" though this does not mean it lights up or anything, so I am guessing it must be a terminology thing. That said, my black lab loves these, they chuck far, float well, and retrieve well. A great training tool.
customer_reviews.author: outwest

customer_reviews.title: Work Great For Training and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab who LOVES to retrieve these. My son uses these to professionally train his dog, but my dog loves to play with them. He lights up when I get these out to throw for him. They are a perfect size for him (he weighs north of 100 pounds) as they are designed to fit in their mouth comfortably and the rope on the end gives you the leverage to twirl them a few times to build momentum so they can sail through the air a long way. They last for a very long time!! This is a great product! I am not compensated in any way to review this product.
customer_reviews.author: Karla K.

customer_reviews.title: This product has changed in a bad way.
customer_reviews.text: What happened to these. I have been buying these for almost 20 years. These have been our go to training dummies for two different hunting dogs. They normally last months before I have to replace one. We train/play with them daily. I just got my annual 6 pack. These normally last me a year. I have been using these 6 since the beginning of January. I am about to throw out a second one. These are lasting a few days now. Something has changed and it is not for the better.
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Perfect texture and hardness
customer_reviews.text: These bumpers are just the right degree of hardness to be durable, but give a little when you squeeze them. They are great because this level of firmness makes it easy for the dog to pick up and hang on to and not hard enough to damage their teeth with repeated fetches. Obviously these are training tools and not made to be chew toys for your dog, but these will last a long time when used as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak eyelets. Pup breaks in training in a few seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just my boykin, but she cuts the rope within 2 seconds and if you turn for a second the eyelet for the rope kn the bumper is cut. The plastic is soft and pliable, which is ok. The problem isn't even the really cheap rope. The pain is that if she happens to cut the eyelet, the bumper it trash. No rope will ever stay there again. I do not use these as chew toes, only training aids. They dont hold up. If you have a pup that doesn't ever chew on anything, ever, these may work better.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: My dog destroyed it in 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy desperate to find something my dog could have for a long time for fetching or just chewing that he wouldn’t completely annihilate within the first 5 minutes. Well this was not the right toy at all. I feel in the right sane dog’s paws... it would be a great training or recreational fetching toy but for those with heavy chewers... don’t even bother. I’m still on the hunt for some plastic toy like this that he can’t chew through. It was great for fetching while it lasted. Rip :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical and durable
customer_reviews.text: What a great investment, I bought this to use at the beach and it was a success. I have since used at the dog park and on multiple occasions. The bright color and the fact that it floats are very handy. What I have found very useful is the small piece of rope. It allows me to really swing this thing and launch it very far, rather than just throwing the plastic. My lab loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Phil. L

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Dependable and Safe
customer_reviews.text: I toss this “flasher” bumper to my Labrador Retriever when she competes in dock diving competitions. Loves: •The black and white pattern makes it easy for my Lucy Bird to see the spinning bumper. •The hex style allows her to easily grip and to hold on to the bumper. •Has just the right amount of “give” to allow a safe grip This prevents tooth damage. Concerns: •None.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Made it a whole 30 min...
customer_reviews.text: I got home at 6:38 pm. The time is now 7:08 pm. Obviously not that great of a product. I’m sorry but my kongs last years. I was hoping these would be a great duck training tool but they’ll be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.E

customer_reviews.title: not durable, junk!
customer_reviews.text: I use bumpers to train my lab for hunting season. Thé Avery jumpers are JUNK! Broke one after 1 week, broke thé second this week. After 4 weeks, I now have 4 left of thé 6. Go to Gundogsupply.com if you want durable long lasting bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Dog training Dream come true!
customer_reviews.text: Love these for training or just playing around. I don't have much of a throw arm but still get a pretty good distance when I throw these. This is our Lab's best friend. Easy to spot too. Last forever if you just use them to fetch. But If you have a chewer or dog with a strong jaw, make sure you don't leave them out. Our Pittbulls will chew them to tiny pieces in a matter of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Didier

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd Resistant
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherds love to swim and retrieve. German Shepherds are not known for their "soft mouth" as are Golden Retrievers and several other breeds. However these dummies hold up better than any other brand of rubber bumper. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Motorman

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get my order because of multiple issues with the parcel service but the seller was not hard to contact & was able to resolve the issue very promptly. Great customer service!!! I'm very happy with this purchase. Our belgian shepherd loves to retrieve it in water. We don't let him sit and chew on it because he's an aggressive chewer and I'm starting to see him making holes on it. Other than that, if it's just to play fetch, it's the perfect thing to use for him.
customer_reviews.author: Mqc

customer_reviews.title: my small terrier likes to chase my parents large Lab ...
customer_reviews.text: my small terrier likes to chase my parents large Lab while my dad throws the bumper for exercise/mark training. So i bought this for my terrier and she loves it. The Bumper my parents use for their lab is larger than this one. So if you have a larger dog I would almost get the larger version depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.author: T Monies

customer_reviews.title: Good dummies, but should be tougher.
customer_reviews.text: The current theory is that soft dummies promote soft mouths, but I've never noted that in all the dogs I've ever trained. Some retrievers demolish dummies, yet never rough up birds. One of my two current Labs is like that. These dummies are soft, and puncture quite easily. I've had other brands that were soft in the "squeezable" sense, but the actual plastic was tougher and more puncture-proof. They lasted much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Furtman

customer_reviews.title: Junk - broke on second retrieve
customer_reviews.text: Avery used to make good products - these are not up to their usual quality. I replaced the first three I bought and the second set broke right away as well. Then to add insult to injury, Amazon lost two of the three I returned and said I never returned them. Then they charged my account. And if any of you have ever tried to work out a problem with Amazon you know they purposely give you an endless loop of phone numbers and email addresses that never connect to anyone to avoid resolving the issue. Guess they figure they are so big they can give us the finger. Not renewing prime membership.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline F.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I was not satisfied with this product at all. It feels durable but the first time I used it and it already tore. I was throwing it into the pool. My dog would retrieve it and it’s ripped already.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Yeatts

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dog trainer/toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as fetch and chew toys for my bernese mountain dog, as a cheap alternative to expensive chew toys. Sporting dog training equipment is excellent for that. The ropes will come untied and they'll be lost or eaten, you can throw a few stitches in the knot or otherwise fix the knots if you don't want to lose the rope.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Holding up well
customer_reviews.text: After we discovered the hard way that dogs can’t see red frisbees in the water very well, I hunted for something that would be easier for her to spot and swim within her mouth, and this is doing great. Unfortunately, she still prefers the frisbees, we just have to not take them out, if she spots a frisbee, she’ll drop this in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and float well. Unfortunately, my dog has decided she doesn't care to pull it out of the water any more. I'll put them aside for a bit and try again later.
customer_reviews.author: NDM

customer_reviews.title: A neighbor had given us a toy like this for our golden retriever a few years back
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor had given us a toy like this for our golden retriever a few years back. Eventually the piece of plastic that holds the rope broke loose. We bought this one as a replacement and it’s absolutely fantastic. No complaints whatsoever. We don’t use it for training, but just to play fetch with our dog. She loves it! I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McCorkell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy about these. The first one lasted 6 months before my dog finally punctured it. The old one will now be retired to the back yard and I'll be getting a new one for the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Fudge

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is made of brittle poorly chosen material. It cracked after one use. Its not safe for dogs to use. It fails so quickly your dog is at risk of choking and dying.
customer_reviews.author: audiophile file

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand up to a 40lb dog
customer_reviews.text: I was very careful to control the use of this in an attempt to make it last. After just 5 visits to the lake it already has two holes in it. Save your money and look for something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Gym Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool (but don't mistake this for a chew toy)
customer_reviews.text: These are high-quality retriever bumpers for dog training. They are light, easy for dogs to carry, and easy to throw. They can handle extensive use in water and on land. They are definitely NOT chew toys however - dogs will destroy them quickly if they are allowed to chew the bumpers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best water toy for pups
customer_reviews.text: My lab pup LOVES these things!! They’re her favorite toys to retrieve from the water. She loves to chew and these things are indestructible! Would recommend these to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Birdy

customer_reviews.title: Great water retrieval toy
customer_reviews.text: Great product and price point! Very durable and useful for multiple exercises. Float and easily visible in water
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Wild

customer_reviews.title: Warning tag attached to toy
customer_reviews.text: I have been hesitant to use this because of the warning that was attached to the bumper. The statement that was attached said something about the use of the product could cause cancer. I am not sure if the plastic emits something or what that specifically meant. I had just never seen a warning like that on a dog toy, and it caused concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine for dogs with soft mouths
customer_reviews.text: Came in on time and seemed like a solid training bumper. Took it too a doggy pool party and was playing fetch with a lab who absolutely demolished it after several hard chomps. I’m sure the same would have happened had I had the bumper just a few weeks longer. So in summary, the bumper is fine unless your dog has a very hard mouth. If that’s the case don’t expect it to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Loved this until I realized how easy it was for my 8 month old lab to chew. This pic was after 2 minutes. The piece near the rope it too thin.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Weise

customer_reviews.title: strong durable...
customer_reviews.text: strong durable... bought for our male rough coat collie (57#s) .. he carries it around and loves it... it is slightly large in diameter for his not small mouth
customer_reviews.author: LSBL

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. When we received the bumper it had a slight rubber smell to it, and our pup didn't take to it right away. So I rinsed it down and then rubbed some hot dog on it to make it taste yummy. Now our pup cat get enough play time with it! And it has stood up to my rambunctious puppy's hardcore play!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have a black lab mix breed. He is now 10 months old and about 60 pounds. We use this to play. Its heavy duty especially the rope. He likes to play tug-of-war.
customer_reviews.author: flunkywill

customer_reviews.title: This thing is super durable and I love how heavy it is
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super durable and I love how heavy it is. It is not squishy but firm, which is great. My dog wants to play with this all the time and she gets super excited when I pull it out.This is what I want when I train my dog. I want her to be excited about the training device, which this bumper does.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the ropes were not tide tightly on the bumpers. Usually not a problem but my wife took a couple out to throw for the labs and once the rope comes off her throwing ability is pretty much gone. Nice weight to them so you can throw them a long way. Dogs like them and that's the true test.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Seem Tough
customer_reviews.text: Only used these for a couple of weeks but they are holding up better than previous other brands I have tried. No teeth holes in them yet.
customer_reviews.author: JEH

customer_reviews.title: Loves,loves, loves these things.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Black Lab water retrieval. They are not chew toys it is med.soft durable rubber that allows mouthing not chewing. You really need to stop your dog from chewing all toys but these will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie & Beans

customer_reviews.title: For training, not for play
customer_reviews.text: Thick material, but my lab ripped a hole in it within five minutes. As long as I didn’t let him have it outside the water, it was great, but just a few chews and the whole thing is already in the trash cuz it won’t float with holes in it. Much supervision needed if your pup is a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: mpape

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: great value for the money. Needed alot of these for more than one dog, the multi patterns/colors is good too
customer_reviews.author: D L

customer_reviews.title: Chintzy - one and done
customer_reviews.text: If you dog is well trained not to bite down on the "dummy" these will be passable. If not, your dog will bite through these in one session.
customer_reviews.author: JMZ

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Lasted 1 week. We even made sure he didn’t use it as a chew toy. It started to crack the first full day in the pool just from him squeezing it while running and swimming.
customer_reviews.author: William Warnke

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner to pro
customer_reviews.text: These used to be a little harder discouraging chewing but they are still awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chavez

customer_reviews.title: great value for a multi pack.  good weight, diameter, and rope
customer_reviews.text: hopefully won't need more but will purchase again if I do!
customer_reviews.author: Go Big Bob

customer_reviews.title: Fine product.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Very well made and tough. This toy provided my beloved Lab, Dakota, and me countless hours of retrieving pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: WCB

customer_reviews.title: No durability
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Our dog had one of these for 10 minutes and chewed right through it. Literally in 10 minutes. There is little to no durability nor strength in these. A waste of money since we now have to find others that will last longer. A huge shame since they were a perfect size for fetching and playing.
customer_reviews.author: An Informed Reader

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I think they must be making this product more cheaply. I have a bumper that's about 5 years old (same brand) that is still in good shape. These that I bought recently have all been torn apart by my dog after minimal use. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Best training dummies
customer_reviews.text: I've used Avery dummies for years and I think they are the best. Very good pricing. A solid dummy that will take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: jbhbill

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality...will find a new brand
customer_reviews.text: 1 star due to the poor quality... the rubber is way to soft. It split apart with a few throws.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye_JZ

customer_reviews.title: Durable toy that the doggo loves, but the rope ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable toy that the doggo loves, but the rope was cheaply secured and continues to come undone while playing.
customer_reviews.author: D.Aucoin

customer_reviews.title: Our golden retriever loves this dummy better than the canvas or harder plastic
customer_reviews.text: Very fast delivery. Our golden retriever loves this dummy better than the canvas or harder plastic. It has "squish" to it so she doesn't mouth it alot. She prefers this to the mallard dummy. Floats great too and easy to find in tall brush.
customer_reviews.author: farkindoodle

customer_reviews.title: Great toy . . . a little too tempting to chew unsupervised!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let your lab puppy have this without you nearby . . . they'll chew the end off! That said. Great product. We have one happy boy with these!
customer_reviews.author: David E Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Like the smaller size even though I have a 75 ...
customer_reviews.text: Like the smaller size even though I have a 75 pound lab. We first tried the bigger size, but his mouth was always bleeding after a few minutes of retrieving. Have not had any issues since switching to the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product and will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. But an aggressive chewer like my lab can destroy one pretty quickly. She does fine when training with it, no issues at all. But left one out overnight - - disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C.

customer_reviews.title: Doggo  approved.
customer_reviews.text: Dog likes it. Hasn’t destroyed it which that in itself is impressive. Get you one!
customer_reviews.author: SunOver

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These decoys are tough and fit well in the mouth of my Chesapeakes. Also easy to throw. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mac 7

customer_reviews.title: She’s only 9 months old so she’s rough on the bumpers and they hold up great!!
customer_reviews.text: Our lab loves them. She’s only 9 months old so she’s rough on the bumpers and they hold up great!!! My husband practices with her daily and there’s no wear or tear on them to be seen. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Carly Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and durable
customer_reviews.text: This bumper was way more durable than I expected it’s not like your average cheap bumper with hard crack plastic but this is a more flexible plastic that won’t crack i use this duck training for my dog it works amazing definitely would recommend and will be buying again
customer_reviews.author: Lifewithspringers

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for younger dogs. Trained my black lab with this from basically 4 months to a year/year and a half. He’s done a number but even without the rope he retrieves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Gilleland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to chew to shreds
customer_reviews.text: My Lab ripped the plastic bumper to pieces within a few minutes. He enjoyed fetching it and chewing it up, but the platic is tick enough that it would be dangerous if swallowed. I don't recommend it if your dog is an avid chewer.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Works and endure some chewing
customer_reviews.text: Our dog will destroy most toys when left alone. So far the dog likes it and it can endure some chewing. For the dogs and bumpers safety, we remove the rope if we are not supervising play.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Should last for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I am new to this so I asked a friend who recommended these.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Allen

customer_reviews.title: They work but was a bit disappointed of the quality of these compared to the one ...
customer_reviews.text: They work but was a bit disappointed of the quality of these compared to the one I had used for years that my lab found buried in the sand. The knots keep coming open/loose and they aren't quite as heavy as the found one. They work and my lab loves them and you get a fair product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Retrieving Review
customer_reviews.text: If you have a strong dog don't use it as chew toy. It is not strong enough to withstand constant chewing. Dogs will destroy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It tore!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this brand for years. I just order a new one that came on 6/11 after about 30-40 throws it tore at the top! Not sure if they have changed the material or thickness of this but I’m real bummed out, this brand was my favorite bumper style by far!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Least durable dog toy I’ve ever seen
customer_reviews.text: A dog toy that lasts two throws? That’s what you’ll get with this. After throwing this to my dog two times on the beach, there were three deep cracks in the toy as shown in the photo. Don’t waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: KRIS P

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking product however the narrow end that the rope attaches to arrived cracked. I didn’t feel safe giving to my black lab so I tossed it out. I had it a couple weeks but didn’t open till Christmas. The one I received was of very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and my dogs love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to throw, durable and most importantly my dogs LOVE retrieving them. They work great in the field but are even better when used over water.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lattomus

customer_reviews.title: 2" good size
customer_reviews.text: 2" perfect size for in water retrieve. Rope knot came untied but was able to salvage and retie.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: best quality bumper
customer_reviews.text: I have tested them all with my field goldens, and this one holds up the best! Just wish they weren't so pricey...
customer_reviews.author: christian marbot

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My lab plays with these twice a week in the pond. Much easier to throw than the larger versions.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Moose approves. Old and new pictured. The old ones only lasted a year or so. These seem more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Duck hunting.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for duck hunting training. These are solid and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coletti

customer_reviews.title: These things are sturdy from what I have seen and you can chunk ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these bumpers daily with my 6 month old black Lab and she loves them. They were a little heavy for her at first, but now she is all over them. I was using a paint roller for a while, but you can't throw it more than 10-15 yards without the wind in your favor. These things are sturdy from what I have seen and you can chunk them well over 50 yards. They work great in both water and land. I duct taped teal feathers on to all of mine and the tape sticks pretty well. Adds a whole new element for blind retrieves.
customer_reviews.author: Cdyhawk

customer_reviews.title: Get chewed up quickly
customer_reviews.text: They got chewed up quickly, so quickly we couldn't even work on a softer touch from our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wachter

customer_reviews.title: Color
customer_reviews.text: Great bumpers! My dog loves them. Like the black & white colors. Easy for dog to see.
customer_reviews.author: Halle's Mom

customer_reviews.title: good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty plastic The Rope is too short to toss as far was I want, but that is an easy fix. My dog is not a fan of these, she has two others that are bright green and she prefers them.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Get this rubber bumper! Don’t buy the plastic ones
customer_reviews.text: Best dog toy! My shepherd loves his bumpers. Made extremely well, can swing his 95#s off the ground with this one. He loves tug of war!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a little thicker of rubber. My dog absolutely loves it. But after a little while he can chew through it. I understand it is probably made that way so that it floats. But I think that they could add some more plastic to it and make it more durable. Other than that I enjoy the product and so does my dog
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I had to buy my dog he choose a hole in it by the second day I have a yellow lab
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Holds up really well and he finds it easily
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bumper. My lab easily finds it with the differentiated pattern.
customer_reviews.author: DealHaggler

customer_reviews.title: Best bumpers we have tried
customer_reviews.text: Tried several similar products. These bumpers are the best by far.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure there is better out there but good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised 6 bumpers only one came in the box. False advertising or somone dropped the ball on this one. Good product but dissapointed in the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't had these before. Seem heavier duty than others so should hold up for a long time. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: D123R

customer_reviews.title: Broke in First Use
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for someone else and the product broke the very first day they used it. A whole chunk of the base completely came off. Super upsetting considering I paid money for a VERY low-quality product. It would have been great if it would have lasted more than one day.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylene Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good price. the knots on the cord need redone ...and I think the cords could have been a couple of inched longer - otherwise, definitely good bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Dorin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is working great with my dog. Much better than the bird decoy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Coker

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves Retrieving These!
customer_reviews.text: Good value and very fast shipping, whats not to like?
customer_reviews.author: TheCheeseDog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome 6 pack of dummies - very durable and you can throw it a long ways for the pooch!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate Lab Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes it. What else is there to say?
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Axum III

customer_reviews.title: Best bumpers
customer_reviews.text: Love these for field work and obedience training, my dog absolutely looses her mind for these bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bumpers
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these bumpers with our Golden for a number of weeks. Very durable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: We have a lab puppy and while she’s not ready for it now, it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bumpers
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bumpers. Harder plactic then most bumpers which is nice for getting a hard mouthed dog to not chomp down so hard. Only 2 criticisms are: 1. The are pricey compared to other bumpers and 2. The ropes will not stay tied and they frequently come untied during training, I've lost several so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Clark

customer_reviews.title: It isn't 'pack of 6'
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the product title 'pack of 6'. As others have noted, that is misrepresenting what you get. You get 1. Just 1.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Come up with a string the dog can’t shred & you would have a real win here.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mackling

customer_reviews.title: Has held up well with daily abuse
customer_reviews.text: Rope is a good length Good weight for throwing and carrying on walks Has held up very well with daily abuse.
customer_reviews.author: DWP84

customer_reviews.title: Best Retriever Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is the absolute best! It holds up really well, even though my dog loves to chew! It always floats in water! I have had mine for several months without complaint!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Goode

customer_reviews.title: A good quality item....
customer_reviews.text: This floating dog training device / toy works great. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Womack

customer_reviews.title: Not for pups
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to fully play with these as they are more for a bigger dog and by that I mean not a puppy. Not that it takes anything away from the toy, as the pup loves to chew on them and hasn't destroyed it at all.
customer_reviews.author: john britton

product_meta.title: Avery 2" HexaBumper Dog Training Dummy Pack of 6
product_meta.description:
Developing a great retriever requires a lot of gear. Training bumpers are one of the most important tools. Whether you are throwing marks, running blinds or teaching drills a quality bumper in large quantities is a must. It is perfect for mark training! HexaBumpers are covered by US Patent # D584,864

- 10" floating throw rope is included
- Leak-proof valveless design for long life
- Six flat sides offer dogs easier grip & hold
- Firmer feel helps reduce chomping tendency
- VGrips promote soft mouth with superior hold
- 2" or 3" sizes
- White, orange, or black/white flasher
- HexaBumpers are covered by US Patent #D584,864
feature_bullets: 10 inch floating Throw rope is included
Leak-proof valveless design for long life
Six flat sides offer dogs easier grip and hold
Firmer feel helps reduce chomping tendency
Vgrip promote soft Mouth with superior hold
